title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 412.3 - Liquidation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 412.3 - Liquidation

State Regulations

The Fund for Savings Banks may be liquidated upon
occurrence of: (a) the affirmative
vote to liquidate, taken at a regular or a special meeting, of not less than 75
percent of total number of member banks representing not less than 662/3
percent of the total outstanding deposit liabilities of all the member
banks; (b) the payment of all
liabilities incurred or assumed by the fund under the provisions of the
agreement and article VI-B of the Banking Law; and
(c) the distribution of the balance thereof
to the members pro rata according to their contribution under Banking Law, section 284 and in accordance with article V, section 2 of the
agreement. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
412.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
